comments.body: That is a very good idea.  Minecraft needs more armor.

What if the slime armor had another ability? It could be called spider armor. The slime would allow you to stick to and climb walls and the ceilings while holding the shift key. The more pieces of armor have the slime upgrade, the faster you will move across said surfaces.

You should change the title to Granite, Andesite, Diorite Buttons, Furnaces, and Pressure Plates instead or something similar like that because you are currently not talking about Stone and the polished versions of the following blocks.

Moved to proper category.

Thanks for your contribution.

Hmm. I'm not sure this should be in this category. It seems to be a Biome issue. And you are absolutely correct, this is an amazing idea. Going though forests is so much of a pain, I actively avoid them. The only forest biomes I like are Jungle and Dark Oak.

Nobody builds in forests nobody lives in forests.  If trees averaged leaves starting 4 blocks high, this would be very different.  Then you could cut down a few trees for a clearing and build something, and it would be easy enough to move about.  Simply make forests generate taller on average.

They need to be taller than that! I live in a heavily forested area and I can promise you, the trees are very, very tall. The oaks are fifty+ feet easily. 

If trees are short to try and give an overgrown forest feel, repurpose jungles bushes, kill the grass, go crazy on the leaf litter and bushes, and you've got a great start. Splash in a few of the shorter trees for flavor: there needs to be a lot more taller trees than shorter trees. 

Also, please give the Azalea it's own wood set.
Moved this over to the blocks category. Good luck with your discussion! :)
It definetely needs more purposes, and more "real" sources where to gain it. Grinding pigmen in farms for gold just doesn´t feel right to me.
Golden doors, blocks, trapdoor, ect.

Not really because if you do the math, it's seriously much better if you have 6 Iron Ingots and 1 Stick in the recipe because you get 16 rails for it! If it was replaced with Iron Nuggets then it would way more expensive.

I'm unsure how you reached that conclusion Blast Burner, but he/she is saying, either reduce the price, using Nuggets instead, which are a ninth of the iron for 16 rails, or a ninth of the gold for 6 rails, OR increase the rails per craft giving better value per ingot, making rails cheaper.
with the Caves and Cliffs update coming, they could be made from copper.
Good idea it will give MC a steampunk vibe

what is the pipe recipe 

 

also it should be found above lava, fire, obsidian, and in a swamp biome
Yeah... it was so beautiful and... elegant. Rest in Peace rose... we will miss you.
I remember when they removed the rose and I was like shocked because I liked to put roses around my base and the poppy just wasn’t the same flower.
I miss the rose.
I don't like the idea of the wood swords being dyeable, however, different types of wood swords would be neat.
Seems like a cool idea, but I am not so sure about the dying part.
buena idea
i’ve always wanted dyable wooden swords in minecraft
Yes. This would make minecraft feel more real, yet also more exotic! I like it!
Amazing idea.I would like if corals plants can grow to corals blocks formations using bone meal too.
As this is primarily about the Vending Machine, it has been moved to Blocks, Tools, and Items
Yes, and players can make their own shop with vending machines to sell whatever item they want for whatever item they want
Yesssss I feel it should be crafted out of iron bars instead of iron ingots and It doesn’t have to be crafted out of smooth stone It should be normal stone as well
They don’t want to give you more than 1 nugget when you smelt armory because you can smelt all the armory You get from an zombie farm And that would be too crazy

This is an fantastic idea! There is another comment that mentioned that it could be used as a iron farm "you can smelt all the armory you get from an zombie farm and that would be too crazy", I disagree with this comment as simple iron golem farm produces way more iron and can be made almost anywhere in the world (unlike a zombie farm from a spawner).

On bedrock iron farms are really slow so I think this could make a better iron farm early game, but I think minus 1 nugget is too little, maybe cut it by 50%? Like a undamaged chest plate would give u 35 nuggets

My suggestion is differently:

The idea is just to change the input for the ore and the fuel:

First: we must only use lava buckets for smelting any item. The smelting time could be the same.
Second: the item input should have two slots: that's means the two items can be combined together in only one output item.

This could works like this:

Combining two iron leggings or two iron boots (or one iron boots and one iron helmet) gives you in the output an single iron ingot, instead of a single iron nugget.
The behavior for the gold items (but non food items) will be similarly.
And if we can have a way to recycle the items of netherite (on the next update), it could be in this way: two netherite items to get a single netherite scrap.

The reason that I suggest a lava bucket to do that is just to make the things challenger.

All this won't means that the blast furnace lost their current ability, it just will have one empty slot: at every kind of ore input the blast furnace gives their corresponding smelted item, in a faster way than the normal furnaces.

Furnaces and Blast furnaces has their uses, and I agree with the points:

  • Concept that Blast furnace be faster them normal furnaces even using more fuel
  • Smelt only armor / ores. Completely understandable.
  • Idea of recicle objects (armor) to be used in other application (nuggets). This is a great concept in Minecraft and must be explored!

Things i disagree:

  • Ratio of nuggets you receive per burn. Should be higher to make not profitable but beneficial, stand a clear point to be craft it..
  • Efficiency in smelt ore. Not only in speed. Should affect how efficient it deal with ore (i.e. stone cutter with ratio 1:1). For this we have to consider 2 factors
     
    1) Ingots
    Iron and Gold have to be a better ratio to justify the use of blast furnace. this itens are not affected by fortune i.e. example.
    2) Ores (Affected by fortune pick)
    Coal, Red Stone and Diamond should have a better ratio  but not more then Fortune picks (maybe not level I, but definitely not better then level 2 and 3) because Fortune uses experience points and tools to be make, and blast furnace fuel and a considerably cheaper recipe

Short story, Blast furnace have to have a better benefits to be made. Cannot compete with Fortune Enchant. but be relevant enough to be craft.

I love all the ideas here I really do. But I'm not sure if Mojang is going to add any more enchantments to the trident unfortunately. I don't remember which developer said it but I believe the it was just mainly a water based weapon but I am very pro-trident so I hope they add at least sharpness to it. Wonderful ideas again.

Making Penetration works with Riptide. it will affect a charging impact damage. and it'll make a Riptide creates a Tornado.

Riptide Tornado will Surround player. it was an visual effect,but if update releses now. it's not. Riptide Tornado will Pull mobs and players at in 1 block. and it deals a 6 Damage to mob and players over time.
I suggest u put another new enchantment, Gathering which will work with loyalty, it basically sucks in XP and nearby loot and brings it back with the trident.

I honestly love this idea... The trident is my favorite weapon in minecraft. I think if there could also be some enchant for when you use riptide so you don't take fall damage as much. I know that people can use feather falling on boots but I think that something like feather falling when you are using riptide would be nice.
That should be a thing.
UPDATE: This is now in the game, as of Java Edition snapshot 19w36a
This is already a thing.

I'm all in favor of a global map with the ability to place pinpoints.  That would help so much with adventuring.  Currently I record the coordinates I want to remember in a .txt file and look them up later.  This just seems so tedious.  1 map that you can see the whole world on would be great.  The current system with multiple maps and numbering system is such a pain.

What a GREAT idea! I was playing with my sister once on an infinite world and became worse than lost. You see, I wander a LOT. My sense of direction is really non-existent. Using the current map was of little help for her to find me and return me home. I was so far off the map she had. Another thing I would love to see is the implementation of random spawn points for each player entering a new world. It would make it so fun trying to find each other, but how much easier would that be if we also had your map?!
Let the fireworks be visible from great distances (perhaps an optimized "small color flash/distant dot" look). Thus, players will be able to signal their location.

Membranes are thin pieces of body tissue from the mob and I don't think that it would support a player weight. The Phantom Membrane only acts with Elytra as a sewing item not an item that can be in a recipe to craft wings.

The only reason we can't craft them is because they're too op mainly for flight. That's why we have End Cities. If it was to have a crafting recipe, it would need something else such as Leather instead.
If you put more information about how to make them and how expensive it would be, you would probably get more votes.
I would love to see a elytra crafting recipe but not only phantom membran
I feel this would be too easy. Elytras are meant to be scarce that only a true player should be able to get in survival.
I like how you thought of a way to earn the materials to make it
I think they would be crafted by using leather, two string, and four phantom membranes, all in the shape of a upside down U.
If elytras can get crafted and glue gets added then glue should be in the crafting recapie
If elytras can get crafted and glue gets added then glue should be in the crafting recipe

I think currently Elytras are rightly really hard to obtain and is an endgame item. Most people only get them after defeating the Ender Dragon which arguablay is the end of the games progression. and these then allow you to explore faster the wide and spacious worlds in minecraft. I think it is good to achieve the end part of the game before obtaining it. But if you play with multiple people on realms or servers it becomes ridiculously hard and time consuming to find ever new cities. any small mishap like falling into lava (that is a weird thing to say in the real world...) would then require an unreasonable amount of time to recover an in practice finite amount of elytras. that are reasonably reachable in the end. If you add the option to make it craftable ( Or having it as a master level Trade Item from the leather worker) would therefore be a great addition. But it needs to be hard enough so you can't produce without reaching the end first: so why not include a material that can be only optained from drops of respawning End-Mobs or something that can be replenished only in the End and then taken back to craft and or trade expensively ( talking something like 64 emeralds + multiple said end objects)

An elytra recipe should be unlocked for a player when they retrieve their 1st elytra from an end city.

I think the multiplayer server problem is important. Wherein, the first player to obain an elytra can easily obtain more, and is incentivized to horde a few as insurance against losing flight capability, and occasionally grabs more as they lose them. It becomes increasingly difficult for anyone else to obtain their own, especially for players who don't yet have one. Players with elytra can hand them out, but that would seem to deprive others of the same quest the first player got to experience.

If a player can craft elytras once they've obtained one from an end city, there's no longer an incentive to fly around the end dimension grabbing them up. If people just want to receive one from another player, that still works. If they want to quest for their own and obtain the recipe, that's hopefully a better experience now!
Cool
Indeed, cool
This feature would be usefull for mapmaking.

I would have suggested that the mineral you used to activate the beacon depends on what level effect you getting. Tier 1 beacon effects requires iron, tier 2 beacon effects requires gold, tier 3 beacons require emeralds and tier 4 requires diamonds.
Well emerald is about 25 times rarer than diamonds so i think tier 3 is diamond and tier 4 would be emerald

Okay that's pretty cool, it should be added. Your version the idea creator, not the other commenter, your version gives tasking to get what you want which is a grind which I like. If there is a grind involved I like it, yet if there is a way to think of doing it differently I ultimately do it differently than the typical course of action I like exploits, I hate it that Microsoft takes away exploits, rather than making a version like a game mode similar to creative but it's survival, just every exploit Is available to be done, to reminisce, rather than oh remember that.
But hands down good idea to add to the game, Minecraft Needs more complexity, I just wish they'd add rotating blocks that smoothly move

we need this!

We need this

I suggest some other ideas for this block:

- It can only work with a max of 2 raw material. Example: for mass crafting blocks wich use only 1 item, such as iron blocks, redstone blocks, emerald blocks. Or 2 materials: TNT, lanterns, etc.

- When a crafting is complete, it emits a redstone signal or drops it (when a hopper is connected to it).

- Non stackable.

We really need this!
At least make it so that if the item only needs one type of input it can craft it (ex: slime block, honey block, diamond block, etc.)

How about adding this functionality to the (scrapped) copper golems, with a GUI to select a specific recipe? The golem could pick up items from the ground and throw them at a specific block after they have been crafted. Could add another neat bit of intrigue to the copper golem, and it seems to fit with the character of randomly pressing buttons.
Nice thought
I don't know if it'd feel right exactly how you put it here, however I do think new types of farming equipment on the more basic/primitive side could be really cool and interesting.

I was convinced this was going to be added since it just feels like a missing feature at the momment, a very simple quality of life change alternative to the crafting table's recipes, that are currently very wasteful for no real reason.

Additionally it could allow to craft decorative wooden blocks like signs or trapdoors in precise ammounts or more efficiently.
Perhaps using 1 clay & 8 dirt to make 4 Adobe?  Would give us a way to use up dirt and expand on options for clay slightly.
Sounds good actually
love this idea

it would be nice to have an Adobe option . I love the terracotta but a Mesa biome isn't always easy to find. if you could make Adobe similar so how you create bricks or concrete then it would allow you to extend the use items that we usually don't bother with.

I don't understand why this doesn't have more support on it? This would be so nice to have on Java edition, it really should have existed since maps were added back in 2011. Being able to see your Overworld location on a map in the Nether would be so helpful, and even more so if portal creation was made easier without having to create two portals in similar locations in the Nether and Overworld.
Linking nether portals would be way easier with this, if you didn’t want to do all the math.

I really like this feature. This is really useful on bedrock. If you buy a treasure map from a cartographer, you can go into the nether to find the mansion or ocean monument very quickly, since it will show you whether you would be at the structure when going into the overworld. I often use this meachanic for this on bedrock.

huh... you know, this actually must make sense. Since like, you travel faster in the nether because you are closer to the planet's core (and thus make smaller circular envelope), the overworld map must indeed (if we're okay with it sort of having a "GPS" pointer from the beginning) show just us travelling 8x further
If only cauldrons would allow the players to remove dye of wool blocks. They can only do that on leather armor sadly.
What i want is for the player to use the dye again after it is removed from the wool, that's more than what a cauldron does for leather armor
I like the concept, but I don't know if a new block is necessary for the task.
Clarified topic accordingly.

I was thinking about ways to get large quantities of each color dye. For example if you want a bunch of colored concrete. With some sheep you can easily get a large amount of wool of your desired color. What if you could dye water in a caldron with the wool, fill a bucket or glass bottle with the colored water, then smelt said water container to produce the dye component?
I was thinking something like 1 bucket of water and 9 wool of the same color to give 3 dye (and give back the bucket minus the water)
Was about to give feedback on the same thing. I really want the ability to do that.
What if it removed a “dye fragment” and you would need to combine multiple to get your dye back
I'm pretty sure you can waterlog cauldrons, or at least on Bedrock Edition.

I thought about this as I was thinking about the fact that most of the magic in minecraft is tied to heat, like the crazy heat of the nether, lava being cooled and heated in a special process for the portal, and the intense heat of lightning changing mobs into magical versions of themselves. Then I thought about fulgurites, and I wondered if that could be a cool magical block! I think it would be great for decoration too, but what if it also had new magical uses? I really don't care what, as long as it has some. Maybe if you try to mine a fulgurite without silk touch, it will drop blaze powder? That might help explain why the heck the villagers have brewing stands without going to the nether. I also just really want the lore of minecraft to make sense. They must have some kind of overworld source of blaze rods, or they wouldn't be able to make the brewing stand. This was my solution. Thank you for having this idea and posting about it!
